message_history.content:
A conversation between User and Assistant. The user asks a question, and the Assistant answers it. The Assistant analyzes the given question and information in the mind, retains important relevant information, calls a search engine to find necessary information, accesses web pages with certain urls, and provides the user with the answer. The Assistant conducts search by <search> query </search>, access certain url by <access> url </access>, and the top search results and url page will be returned between <information> and </information>.  The reasoning processes are enclosed within <think> </think>. Finally, the Assistant provides answer inside <answer> and </answer>, i.e. <answer> answer here </answer>. If there are multiple queries, ensure all answers are enclosed within <answer> </answer>, seperated with comma. 

Note: the question is a valid question and you should try to find a correct answer. 

User: Need to analyze the trend of the U.S. federal government spending and deficit before and after the pandemic. Please provide me with the following data through fiscal years 2015-2024: the federal Budget (trillion), the federal spending (trillion), the federal deficit (trillion), the national debt (trillion), and the net interest cost on the gross federal debt (trillion).

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Fiscal Year, Federal Budget, Federal Spending, Federal Deficit, National Debt, Net Interest Cost.
 
Under the Fiscal Year, state the statistics like FY2015, FY2016.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```

Assistant: 
<think>

To find the required data for the U.S. federal government spending and deficit from fiscal years 2015 to 2024, I'll search through reliable sources. </think>
<search> federal Budget (trillion) 2015-2024 </search>

Search query: federal Budget (trillion) 2015-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data The federal government spent $7.01 trillion in FY 2025. This means federal spending was equal to 23% of the total gross domestic product (GDP), or economic ...

[Doc 2](https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/where-do-our-federal-tax-dollars-go):
Where Do Our Federal Tax Dollars Go? In fiscal year 2024, the federal government spent $6.9 trillion, amounting to 24 percent of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), ...

[Doc 3](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/61181):
The Federal Budget in Fiscal Year 2024: An Infographic The federal deficit in 2024 was $1.8 trillion, equal to 6.4 percent of gross domestic product.

[Doc 4](https://www.pgpf.org/federal-budget-guide/):
Understanding the Federal Budget | Peterson Foundation In 2024, total federal spending was $6.8 trillion — nearly 25 percent of the size of our economy and $20,100 for each person living in the United States.

[Doc 5](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data In FY 2025, the federal government spent $7.01 trillion and collected $5.23 trillion in revenue, resulting in a deficit. The amount by which spending exceeds ...
I need to find the exact data for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2024. I'll focus my search on specific tables or databases that provide such fiscal data.

</think>
<search> federal spending 2015-2024 trillion </search>

Search query: federal spending 2015-2024 trillion
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the federal spending of $1.25 trillion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024) our federal spending has decreased by $55 billion.

[Doc 2](https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/where-do-our-federal-tax-dollars-go):
Where Do Our Federal Tax Dollars Go? In fiscal year 2024, the federal government spent $6.9 trillion, amounting to 24 percent of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), ...

[Doc 3](https://www.pgpf.org/federal-budget-guide/):
Understanding the Federal Budget In 2024, total federal spending was $6.8 trillion — nearly 25 percent of the size of our economy and $20,100 for each person living in the United States.

[Doc 4](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/most-recent/graphics):
Graphics Mandatory outlays by the federal government totaled $4.1 trillion in 2024; more than half was for Social Security and Medicare.

[Doc 5](https://www.wsj.com/economy/us-federal-debt-budget-deficit-spending-charts-650f2dff?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=AWEtsqc_jbtn0zXDRsCE2zhae9ZimMc6g9-SArFsCSZ9TqlwrbRF93k-skY5&gaa_ts=696a2f87&gaa_sig=DBfwWNEKB8z7ldIJMuZuM2iSV-YayOw3tvWV2I2gCuaLMGhmpRKYvPuPlUTYdbiN8QkS5Mm6IyoOIfg6vW6kvA%3D%3D):
Here's How Government Spending Has Grown—and ... Measured in unadjusted dollars, spending has jumped to nearly $6.8 trillion in fiscal year 2024 from about $3.7 trillion in 2015. Revenue rose, ...

I've found the federal spending data. Now, I need to find the corresponding data for federal budget, federal deficit, national debt, and net interest cost on the gross federal debt for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2024.

</think>
<search> federal budget 2015-2024 trillion </search>

Search query: federal budget 2015-2024 trillion
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the federal spending of $1.25 trillion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024) our federal spending has decreased by $55 billion.

[Doc 2](https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/where-do-our-federal-tax-dollars-go):
Where Do Our Federal Tax Dollars Go? In fiscal year 2024, the federal government spent $6.9 trillion, amounting to 24 percent of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), ...

[Doc 3](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/61181):
The Federal Budget in Fiscal Year 2024: An Infographic The federal deficit in 2024 was $1.8 trillion, equal to 6.4 percent of gross domestic product.

[Doc 4](https://www.pgpf.org/federal-budget-guide/):
Understanding the Federal Budget | Peterson Foundation In 2024, total federal spending was $6.8 trillion — nearly 25 percent of the size of our economy and $20,100 for each person living in the United States.

[Doc 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_federal_budget):
United States federal budget - Wikipedia CBO projects a federal budget deficit of $1.6 trillion for 2024. In the agency's projections, deficits generally increase over the coming years; the shortfall ...
I'll switch to searching for the federal deficit, national debt, and net interest cost data for each fiscal year.

</think>
<search> federal deficit 2015-2024 trillion </search>

Search query: federal deficit 2015-2024 trillion
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data In FY 2025 total government spending was $7.01 trillion and total revenue was $5.23 trillion, resulting in a deficit of $1.78 trillion, a decrease of $41 ...

[Doc 2](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/report/deficit-tracker/):
Deficit Tracker - Bipartisan Policy Center The federal government's deficit in fiscal year 2025 was $1.8 trillion—4% lower than last year's after adjusting for timing effects. Revenues increased by 6%, ...

[Doc 3](https://www.crfb.org/blogs/12-month-deficit-totals-17-trillion-debt-approaches-100-gdp):
12-Month Deficit Totals $1.7 Trillion, Debt Approaches 100% of GDP The federal budget deficit totaled $1.74 trillion between November 2024 and October 2025 according to estimates from the Congressional Budget ...

[Doc 4](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/59710):
The Budget and Economic Outlook: 2024 to 2034 The deficit totals $1.6 trillion in fiscal year 2024, grows to $1.8 trillion in 2025, and then returns to $1.6 trillion by 2027. Thereafter, ...

[Doc 5](https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/deficits-debt-and-interest):
Deficits, Debt, and Interest | Center on Budget and Policy Priorities Gross debt reached $37.4 trillion by the end of fiscal year 2025, with the U.S. government trust funds and other federal government accounts ...
I'll search specifically for the national debt and net interest cost on the gross federal debt.

</think>
<search> national debt 2015-2024 trillion </search>

Search query: national debt 2015-2024 trillion
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.investopedia.com/us-national-debt-by-year-7499291):
U.S. National Debt by Year - Investopedia As of October 2025, the U.S. national debt was over $38 trillion. Tax cuts, stimulus programs, and increased government spending on defense can cause the ...

[Doc 2](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-debt/):
Understanding the National Debt | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data The federal government currently has $38.43 trillion in federal debt. Learn how the national debt works and how it impacts you.

[Doc 3](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/datasets/historical-debt-outstanding/):
Historical Debt Outstanding | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Historical summary of the U.S. government's total outstanding debt at the beginning of each fiscal year.

National debt of the United States - Wikipedia In February 2024, the total federal government debt rose to $34.4 trillion, after increasing by approximately $1 trillion during each of two separate 100-day ...

[Doc 5](https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/republicans/debt-dashboard):
Debt Dashboard - U.S. Congress Joint Economic Committee As of December 03, 2025, total gross national debt is $38.40 trillion. Debt held by the public is $30.84 trillion. Intragovernmental debt is $7.56 trillion.
I'll now search for the net interest cost on the gross federal debt.

</think>
<search> net interest cost gross federal debt 2015-2024 trillion </search>

Search query: net interest cost gross federal debt 2015-2024 trillion
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-debt/):
Understanding the National Debt | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Over the past 100 years, the U.S. federal debt has increased from $381 B in 1925 to $37.64 T in 2025. Comparing a country's debt to its gross domestic product ( ...

Interest Costs on the Debt Will Soon Be at an All-Time High Relative to the size of the economy, interest costs would reach 3.2 percent of gross ... Net Interest (% of Federal Revenues). 1965 1975 ...

Interest on the Debt to Grow Past $1 Trillion Next Year In 2025, CBO projects net interest will total $952 billion, a near-record 3.2 percent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP), and interest will eclipse its record as ...

Deficits, Debt, and Interest | Center on Budget and Policy Priorities Gross debt reached $37.4 trillion by the end of fiscal year 2025 ... Interest costs are determined by both the level of net debt — the ...

The Budget and Economic Outlook: 2025 to 2035 It amounts to 6.2 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) in 2025 and drops to 5.2 percent by 2027 as revenues increase faster than outlays. In ...
